 4446: %% Req. Test1, TestTrapv2
 4447: mt_trap_test(MA, MT) ->
 4448:     ?NPRINT("Testing trap-sending with multi threaded (~w) agent...", [MT]),
 4449:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(01) -> issue testTrapv22 (standard trap)", []),
 4450:     snmpa:send_trap(MA, testTrapv22, "standard trap"),
 4451:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(02) -> await v2trap", []),
 4452:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0],   any},
 4453: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?system ++ [0,1]}]),
 4454: 
 4455:     %% multi-threaded = true
 4456:     %% This will *lock* the 'main thread' of a multi-threaded agent,
 4457:     %% the worker state will be 'busy'. Therefore when a new request
 4458:     %% arrives a new *temporary* worker will be spawned.
 4459:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(03) -> issue mtTrap (standard trap)", []),
 4460:     snmpa:send_trap(MA, mtTrap, "standard trap"),
 4461:     Pid = get_multi_pid(),
 4462:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(04) -> multi pid: ~p. Now request sysUpTime...", [Pid]),
 4463:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 4464: 
 4465:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(06) -> await sysUpTime", []),
 4466:     ?expect1([{[sysUpTime,0], any}]),
 4467: 
 4468:     %% This will *only* work if multi-threaded is 'true', not 'extended'
 4469:     %% since in the latter case all notifications are serialized through
 4470:     %% a dedicated worker, which is now locked (see above).
 4471: 
 4472:     if
 4473:         (MT =:= true) ->
 4474:             ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(07) -> issue testTrapv22 (standard trap)", []),
 4475:             snmpa:send_trap(MA, testTrapv22, "standard trap"),
 4476:             ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(08) -> await v2trap", []),
 4477:             ?expect2(v2trap,
 4478:                            [{[sysUpTime, 0],   any}, 
 4479:                             {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?system ++ [0,1]}]);
 4480:         true ->
 4481:             ok
 4482:     end,
 4483: 
 4484:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(09) -> send continue to multi-pid", []),
 4485:     Pid ! continue,
 4486: 
 4487:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(10) -> await v2trap", []),
 4488:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 4489: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?testTrap ++ [2]},
 4490: 			    {[multiStr,0], "ok"}]),
 4491:     ?IPRINT("mt_trap_test(11) -> done", []),
 4492:     ok.
 4493: 
 4494:     
 4495: get_multi_pid() ->
 4496:     get_multi_pid(10).
 4497: get_multi_pid(0) ->
 4498:     ?FAIL(no_global_name);
 4499: get_multi_pid(N) ->
 4500:     ?SLEEP(1000),
 4501:     case global:whereis_name(snmp_multi_tester) of
 4502: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> Pid;
 4503: 	_ -> get_multi_pid(N-1)
 4504:     end.

 4533: %% Req. Test1
 4534: implied_test(MA) ->
 4535:     ?IPRINT("implied_test -> start"),
 4536: 
 4537:     ?NPRINT("Testing IMPLIED..."),
 4538: 
 4539:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, trace),
 4540: 
 4541:     %% Create two rows, check that they are get-nexted in correct order.
 4542:     Idx1 = "apa",
 4543:     Idx2 = "qq",
 4544:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 1 '~s' in table 1",[Idx1]),
 4545:     s([{[testStatus, Idx1], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr, Idx1],s,"row 1"}]),
 4546:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx1], ?createAndGo},
 4547: 		    {[testDescr, Idx1], "row 1"}]),
 4548:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 2 '~s' in table 1",[Idx2]),
 4549:     s([{[testStatus, Idx2], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr, Idx2],s,"row 2"}]),
 4550:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx2], ?createAndGo},
 4551: 		    {[testDescr, Idx2], "row 2"}]),
 4552:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr)",[]),
 4553:     gn([[testDescr]]),
 4554:     ?expect1([{[testDescr,Idx1], "row 1"}]),
 4555:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr) of row 1",[]),
 4556:     gn([[testDescr,Idx1]]),
 4557:     ?expect1([{[testDescr,Idx2], "row 2"}]),
 4558: 
 4559:     % Delete the rows
 4560:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 1 '~s' from table 1",[Idx1]),
 4561:     s([{[testStatus, Idx1], i, ?destroy}]),
 4562:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx1], ?destroy}]),
 4563:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 2 '~s' from table 1",[Idx2]),
 4564:     s([{[testStatus, Idx2], i, ?destroy}]),
 4565:     ?expect1([{[testStatus, Idx2], ?destroy}]),
 4566: 
 4567:     %% Try the same in other table
 4568:     Idx3 = [1, "apa"],
 4569:     Idx4 = [1, "qq"],
 4570:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 1 '~s' in table 2",[Idx3]),
 4571:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx3], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr2,Idx3],s,"row 1"}]),
 4572:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx3], ?createAndGo},
 4573: 		    {[testDescr2, Idx3], "row 1"}]),
 4574:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) create row 2 '~s' in table 2",[Idx4]),
 4575:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx4], i, ?createAndGo}, {[testDescr2,Idx4],s,"row 2"}]),
 4576:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx4], ?createAndGo},
 4577: 		    {[testDescr2, Idx4], "row 2"}]),
 4578:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr2)",[]),
 4579:     gn([[testDescr2]]),
 4580:     ?expect1([{[testDescr2,Idx3], "row 1"}]),
 4581:     ?DBG("implied_test -> get-next(testDescr2) of row 1",[]),
 4582:     gn([[testDescr2,Idx3]]),
 4583:     ?expect1([{[testDescr2,Idx4], "row 2"}]),
 4584: 
 4585:     % Delete the rows
 4586:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 1 '~s' from table 2",[Idx3]),
 4587:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx3], i, ?destroy}]),
 4588:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx3], ?destroy}]),
 4589:     ?DBG("implied_test -> (send) delete row 2 '~s' from table 2",[Idx4]),
 4590:     s([{[testStatus2, Idx4], i, ?destroy}]),
 4591:     ?expect1([{[testStatus2, Idx4], ?destroy}]),
 4592: 
 4593:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, log),
 4594: 
 4595:     ?IPRINT("implied_test -> done", []),
 4596:     ok.
 4597:

 4626:     s([{[sparseStatus, Idx2], i, ?destroy}]),

 4630: %% Req. Test1
 4631: cnt_64_test(MA) ->
 4632:     ?IPRINT("start cnt64 test (~p)", [MA]),
 4633:     snmpa:verbosity(MA, trace),
 4634:     ?IPRINT("start cnt64 test"),
 4635: 
 4636:     ?NPRINT("Testing Counter64, and at the same time, "
 4637:             "RowStatus is not last column"),
 4638:     
 4639:     ?DBG("get cnt64",[]),
 4640:     g([[cnt64,0]]),
 4641:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4642:     ?v1_2(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 4643: 		?expect1([{[cnt64,0],18446744073709551615}])),
 4644:     ?DBG("get-next cnt64",[]),
 4645:     gn([[cnt64]]),
 4646:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4647:     ?v1_2(?expect1([{[cnt64Str,0], "after cnt64"}]),
 4648: 		?expect1([{[cnt64,0],18446744073709551615}])),
 4649:     ?DBG("send cntTrap",[]),
 4650:     snmpa:send_trap(MA,cntTrap,"standard trap",[
 4651: 						{sysContact,  "pelle"},
 4652: 						{cnt64,       10},
 4653: 						{sysLocation, "here"}
 4654: 					       ]),
 4655:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4656:     ?v1_2(?expect5(trap, [test], 6, 1, [{[sysContact,0], "pelle"},
 4657: 					      {[sysLocation,0], "here"}]),
 4658: 		?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 4659: 				  {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?testTrap ++ [1]},
 4660: 				  {[sysContact,0], "pelle"},
 4661: 				  {[cnt64,0], 10},
 4662: 				  {[sysLocation,0], "here"}])),
 4663:     
 4664:     %% Create two rows, check that they are get-nexted in correct order.
 4665:     Idx1 = 1,
 4666:     Idx2 = 2,
 4667:     ?DBG("create row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx1]),
 4668:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx1], i, ?createAndGo}]),
 4669:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4670:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx1], ?createAndGo}]),
 4671:     ?DBG("create row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx2]),
 4672:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx2], i, ?createAndGo}]),
 4673:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4674:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx2], ?createAndGo}]),
 4675: 
 4676:     ?DBG("get-next (cntIndex)",[]),
 4677:     gn([[cntIndex]]),
 4678:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4679:     ?v1_2(?expect1([{[cntStatus,Idx1], ?active}]),
 4680: 		?expect1([{[cntCnt,Idx1], 0}])),
 4681:     % Delete the rows
 4682:     ?DBG("delete row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx1]),
 4683:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx1], i, ?destroy}]),
 4684:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4685:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx1], ?destroy}]),
 4686:     ?DBG("delete row (cntStatus): ~p",[Idx2]),
 4687:     s([{[cntStatus, Idx2], i, ?destroy}]),
 4688:     ?DBG("await response",[]),
 4689:     ?expect1([{[cntStatus, Idx2], ?destroy}]),
 4690:     catch snmpa:verbosity(MA, log),
 4691:     ?DBG("done",[]),
 4692:     ok.

 5326: %% snmpa_notification_delivery_info_receiver callback function
 5327: delivery_targets(Tag, Addresses, Extra) ->
 5328:     io:format("~w:delivery_targets -> entry with"
 5329: 	      "~n   Tag:       ~p"
 5330: 	      "~n   Addresses: ~p"
 5331: 	      "~n   Extra:     ~p"
 5332: 	      "~n", [?MODULE, Tag, Addresses, Extra]),
 5333:     {value, {_, Pid}} = lists:keysearch(recv, 1, Extra),
 5334:     {value, {_, Ref}} = lists:keysearch(ref,  1, Extra),
 5335:     case lists:keysearch(tag,  1, Extra) of
 5336: 	{value, {_, Tag}} ->
 5337: 	    Pid ! {targets, Ref, ok};
 5338: 	{value, {_, OtherTag}} ->
 5339: 	    Pid ! {targets, Ref, {error, {wrong_tag, Tag, OtherTag}}}
 5340:     end,
 5341:     ok.
 5342: 
 5343: %% snmpa_notification_delivery_info_receiver callback function
 5344: delivery_info(Tag, Address, DeliveryResult, Extra) ->
 5345:     io:format("~w:delivery_info -> entry with"
 5346: 	      "~n   Tag:            ~p"
 5347: 	      "~n   Address:        ~p"
 5348: 	      "~n   DeliveryResult: ~p"
 5349: 	      "~n   Extra:          ~p"
 5350: 	      "~n", [?MODULE, Tag, Address, DeliveryResult, Extra]),
 5351:     {value, {_, Pid}} = lists:keysearch(recv, 1, Extra),
 5352:     {value, {_, Ref}} = lists:keysearch(ref,  1, Extra),
 5353:     case lists:keysearch(tag,  1, Extra) of
 5354: 	{value, {_, Tag}} ->
 5355: 	    Pid ! {info, Ref, ok};
 5356: 	{value, {_, OtherTag}} ->
 5357: 	    Pid ! {info, Ref, {error, {wrong_tag, Tag, OtherTag}}}
 5358:     end,
 5359:     ok.
 5360: 
 5361: 
 5362: command_handler([]) ->    
 5363:     ok;
 5364: command_handler([{_No, _Desc, Cmd}|Rest]) ->
 5365:     ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w: ~n   ~s", [_No, _Desc]),
 5366:     %% case (catch Cmd()) of
 5367:     %%     ok ->
 5368:     %%         ?IPRINT("command_handler -> ~w: ok", [_No]),
 5369:     %%         command_handler(Rest);
 5370:     %%     {error, Reason} ->
 5371:     %%         ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w error: ~n~p", [_No, Reason]),
 5372:     %%         ?FAIL(Reason);
 5373:     %%     Error ->
 5374:     %%         ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w unexpected: ~n~p", [_No, Error]),
 5375:     %%         ?FAIL({unexpected_command_result, Error})
 5376:     %% end.
 5377:     try Cmd() of
 5378:         ok ->
 5379:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> ~w: ok", [_No]),
 5380:             command_handler(Rest);
 5381:         {error, Reason} ->
 5382:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w error", [_No]),
 5383:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5384:             if
 5385:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5386:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w error: ~n~p", [_No, Reason]),
 5387:                     ?FAIL(Reason);
 5388:                 true ->
 5389:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5390:                             "failed when we got system events: "
 5391:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 5392:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5393:                             "~n", [Reason, SysEvs]),
 5394:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5395:             end;
 5396:         Error ->
 5397:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w unexpected", [_No]),
 5398:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5399:             if
 5400:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5401:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5402:                             "~w unexpected: ~n~p", [_No, Error]),
 5403:                     ?FAIL({unexpected_command_result, Error});
 5404:                 true ->
 5405:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5406:                             "unexpected when we got system events: "
 5407:                             "~n   Unexpected: ~p"
 5408:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5409:                             "~n", [Error, SysEvs]),
 5410:                     ?SKIP([{unexpected, Error}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5411:             end
 5412:     catch
 5413:         C:E:S ->
 5414:             ?IPRINT("command_handler -> command ~w caught", [_No]),
 5415:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 5416:             if
 5417:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 5418:                     ?EPRINT("command_handler -> ~w caught: "
 5419:                             "~n   Class: ~p"
 5420:                             "~n   Error: ~p"
 5421:                             "~n   Stack: ~p", [_No, C, E, S]),
 5422:                     ?FAIL({catched_command_result, {C, E, S}});
 5423:                 true ->
 5424:                     ?WPRINT("command_handler -> "
 5425:                             "caught when we got system events: "
 5426:                             "~n   Caught: "
 5427:                             "~n      Class:   ~p"
 5428:                             "~n      Error:   ~p"
 5429:                             "~n      Stack:   ~p"
 5430:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 5431:                             "~n", [C, E, S, SysEvs]),
 5432:                     ?SKIP([{caught, {C, E, S}}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 5433:             end
 5434:     end.
 5435:     
 5436: 
 5437: ma_v1_2_v2_trap(MA) ->
 5438:     snmpa:send_trap(MA,linkDown,"standard trap",[{ifIndex, [1], 1}]),
 5439:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 5440: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?snmpTraps ++ [3]},
 5441: 			    {[ifIndex, 1], 1},
 5442: 			    {[snmpTrapEnterprise, 0], [1,2,3]}]).
 5443: 
 5444:     
 5445: ma_v1_2_v2_trap2(MA) ->
 5446:     snmpa:send_trap(MA,testTrap2,"standard trap",[{sysContact,"pelle"}]),
 5447:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 5448: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?system ++ [0,1]},
 5449: 			    {[system, [4,0]], "pelle"},
 5450: 			    {[snmpTrapEnterprise, 0], ?system}]).
 5451:

 5456:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime, 0], any},
 5457: 			    {[snmpTrapOID, 0], ?ericsson ++ [0, 1]},
 5458: 			    {[system, [4,0]],
 5459: 			     "{mbj,eklas}@erlang.ericsson.se"},
 5460: 			    {[sa, [1,0]], "sa_test"},
 5461: 			    {[snmpTrapEnterprise, 0], ?ericsson}]),
 5462:     snmpa:verbosity(SA, {subagents, silence}),
 5463:     ok.

 5492: %% Req. SA-MIB, OLD-SNMPEA-MIB
 5493: sa_errs_bad_value() ->
 5494:     NewKeyc3 = [intCommunityEntry,[3],get(mip),is("test")],
 5495:     NewKeyc4 = [intCommunityEntry,[4],get(mip),is("test")],
 5496:     NewKeyc5 = [intCommunityEntry,[5],get(mip),is("test")],
 5497:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},
 5498:        {[sa, [2,0]], 5}, % badValue (i is_set_ok)
 5499:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo},
 5500:        {NewKeyc4, 2}]),
 5501:     ?expect3(badValue, 2, any),
 5502:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},
 5503:        {[sa, [2,0]], 6}, % wrongValue (i is_set_ok)
 5504:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo},
 5505:        {NewKeyc4, 2}]),
 5506:     ?expect3(?v1_2(badValue, wrongValue), 2, any),
 5507:     g([NewKeyc4]),
 5508:     ?v1_2(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 5509: 		?expect1([{NewKeyc4, noSuchInstance}])).
 5510: 
 5511: %% Req. SA-MIB, OLD-SNMPEA-MIB
 5512: sa_errs_gen_err() ->
 5513:     NewKeyc3 = [intCommunityEntry,[3],get(mip),is("test")],
 5514:     NewKeyc4 = [intCommunityEntry,[4],get(mip),is("test")],
 5515:     NewKeyc5 = [intCommunityEntry,[5],get(mip),is("test")],
 5516:     s([{NewKeyc3, 2},{NewKeyc4, 2},
 5517:        {NewKeyc5, ?createAndGo}, {[sa, [3,0]], 5}]),
 5518:     ?expect3(genErr, 4, any),
 5519: % The row might have been added; we don't know.
 5520: % (as a matter of fact we do - it is added, because the agent
 5521: % first sets its own vars, and then th SAs. Lets destroy it.
 5522:     s([{NewKeyc5, ?destroy}]),
 5523:     ?expect1([{NewKeyc5, ?destroy}]).
 5524:

 5526: sa_too_big() ->
 5527:     g([[sa, [4,0]]]),
 5528:     ?expect1(tooBig).
 5529:

 5532:     gn([[sysDescr],[klas1,5]]),

 5534: 		    {[snmpInPkts, 0], any}]).

 5536: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]). -> noError
 5537: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]). -> {badValue, 2}
 5538: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 3], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]). -> {genErr, 1}
 5539: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]). -> {genErr, 1}
 5540: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ufail"}]). -> {genErr, 1}
 5541: %% snmp_test_mgr:s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "xfail"}]). -> {genErr, 2}
 5542: %% Req. Klas3, Klas4
 5543: undo_test() ->
 5544:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5545:     ?expect1([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5546:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]),
 5547:     ?expect3(?v1_2(badValue, inconsistentValue), 2, any),
 5548:     s([{[fStatus3, 3], 4}, {[fname3,0], "hoj"}]),
 5549:     ?expect3(?v1_2(genErr, undoFailed), 1, any),
 5550:     s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ok"}]),
 5551:     ?expect3(?v1_2(genErr, commitFailed), 1, any),
 5552: % unfortunately we don't know if we'll get undoFailed or commitFailed.
 5553: % it depends on which order the agent traverses the varbind list.
 5554: %    s([{[fStatus3, 4], 4}, {[fname3,0], "ufail"}]),
 5555: %    expect(5, ?v1_2(genErr, undoFailed), 1, any),
 5556:     s([{[fStatus3, 1], 4}, {[fname3,0], "xfail"}]),
 5557:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any).
 5558:     
 5559: %% Req. Klas3, Klas4
 5560: bad_return() ->
 5561:     g([[fStatus4,4],
 5562:        [fName4,4]]),
 5563:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5564:     g([[fStatus4,5],
 5565:        [fName4,5]]),
 5566:     ?expect3(genErr, 1, any),
 5567:     g([[fStatus4,6],
 5568:        [fName4,6]]),
 5569:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5570:     gn([[fStatus4,7],
 5571:        [fName4,7]]),
 5572:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any),
 5573:     gn([[fStatus4,8],
 5574:        [fName4,8]]),
 5575:     ?expect3(genErr, 1, any),
 5576:     gn([[fStatus4,9],
 5577:        [fName4,9]]),
 5578:     ?expect3(genErr, 2, any).

 5609: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5610: %% For this test, the agent is configured for v1.
 5611: %% o  Test the counters and control objects in SNMP-STANDARD-MIB
 5612: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 5613: snmp_standard_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5614:     ?P(snmp_standard_mib), 
 5615:     init_case(Config),
 5616:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_init", []),
 5617:     try_test(std_mib_init),
 5618: 
 5619:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_a", []),
 5620:     InBadVsns = try_test(std_mib_a),
 5621:     put(vsn, v2),
 5622: 
 5623:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_read", []),
 5624:     try_test(std_mib_read),
 5625:     put(vsn, v1),
 5626: 
 5627:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_b (~w)", [InBadVsns]),
 5628:     Bad = try_test(std_mib_b, [InBadVsns]),
 5629: 
 5630:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_read (community: 'bad community')", []),
 5631:     try_test(std_mib_read, [], [{community, "bad community"}]),
 5632: 
 5633:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_write (community: 'public')", []),
 5634:     try_test(std_mib_write, [], [{community, "public"}]),
 5635: 
 5636:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_asn_err", []),
 5637:     try_test(std_mib_asn_err),
 5638: 
 5639:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_c (~w)", [Bad]),
 5640:     try_test(std_mib_c, [Bad]),
 5641: 
 5642:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_a", []),
 5643:     try_test(standard_mib_a),
 5644:     
 5645:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_finish", []),
 5646:     try_test(std_mib_finish),
 5647: 
 5648:     ?DBG("snmp_standard_mib -> std_mib_test_finish", []),
 5649:     try_test(standard_mib_test_finish, [], [{community, "bad community"}]).
 5650: 
 5651: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB
 5652: standard_mib_a() ->
 5653:     [OutPkts]  = get_req(2, [[snmpOutPkts,0]]),
 5654:     [OutPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpOutPkts,0]]),
 5655:     OutPkts2   = OutPkts + 1,
 5656:     %% There are some more counters we could test here, but it's not that
 5657:     %% important, since they are removed from SNMPv2-MIB.
 5658:     ok.
 5659: 
 5660: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5661: std_mib_init() ->
 5662:     %% disable authentication failure traps.  (otherwise w'd get many of
 5663:     %% them - this is also a test to see that it works).
 5664:     s([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps,0], 2}]),
 5665:     ?expect1([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps, 0], 2}]).
 5666: 
 5667: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5668: std_mib_finish() ->
 5669:     %% enable again
 5670:     s([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps,0], 1}]),
 5671:     ?expect1([{[snmpEnableAuthenTraps, 0], 1}]).
 5672: 
 5673: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB
 5674: standard_mib_test_finish() ->
 5675:     %% force a authenticationFailure (should result in a trap)
 5676:     std_mib_write(),
 5677:     %% check that we got a trap
 5678:     ?expect5(trap, [1,2,3], 4, 0, []).
 5679: 
 5680: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5681: std_mib_read() ->
 5682:     ?DBG("std_mib_read -> entry", []),
 5683:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]), % try a bad <something>; msg dropped, no reply
 5684:     ?DBG("std_mib_read -> await timeout (i.e. no reply)", []),
 5685:     ?expect1(timeout). % make sure we don't get a trap!
 5686: 
 5687: 
 5688: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5689: std_mib_write() ->
 5690:     ?DBG("std_mib_write -> entry", []),
 5691:     s([{[sysLocation, 0], "new_value"}]).
 5692: 
 5693: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5694: std_mib_asn_err() ->
 5695:     snmp_test_mgr:send_bytes([48,99,67,12,0,0,0,0,0,0,5]).

 5725:     put(vsn, v1),
 5726:     try_test(std_mib_read),

 5728:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> bad version read",[]),
 5729:     put(vsn, v2),
 5730:     Bad = try_test(std_mib_b, [InBadVsns]),
 5731: 
 5732:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> read with bad community",[]),
 5733:     try_test(std_mib_read, [], [{community, "bad community"}]),
 5734:

 5736:     try_test(std_mib_write, [], [{community, "public"}]),
 5737: 
 5738:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> asn err", []),
 5739:     try_test(std_mib_asn_err),
 5740: 
 5741:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> check counters",[]),
 5742:     try_test(std_mib_c, [Bad]),
 5743: 
 5744:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> get some counters",[]),
 5745:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_a),
 5746:     
 5747:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> enable auth traps, and await some",[]),
 5748:     try_test(std_mib_finish),
 5749: 
 5750:     ?DBG("snmpv2_mib_2 -> force auth failure, and await trap, "
 5751:          "then disable auth traps", []),
 5752:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_test_finish, [], [{community, "bad community"}]),
 5753:     
 5754:     ?IPRINT("snmpv2_mib_2 -> done"),
 5755:     ok.

 5770: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5771: snmpv2_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5772:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5773:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 5774:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 5775:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 5776:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5777: 
 5778:     ?P(snmpv2_mib_3), 
 5779:     init_case(Config),
 5780: 
 5781:     InBadVsns = try_test(std_mib_a),
 5782:     put(vsn, v1),
 5783:     try_test(std_mib_read),
 5784:     put(vsn, v3),
 5785:     _Bad = try_test(std_mib_b, [InBadVsns]),
 5786:     try_test(snmpv2_mib_a),
 5787: 
 5788:     try_test(std_mib_finish).
 5789:     
 5790: -define(authenticationFailure, [1,3,6,1,6,3,1,1,5,5]).
 5791: 
 5792: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5793: snmpv2_mib_test_finish() ->
 5794:     %% force a authenticationFailure
 5795:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> write to std mib",[]),
 5796:     std_mib_write(),
 5797: 
 5798:     %% check that we got a trap
 5799:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> await trap",[]),
 5800:     ?expect2(v2trap, [{[sysUpTime,0], any},
 5801: 			    {[snmpTrapOID,0], ?authenticationFailure}]),
 5802: 
 5803:     %% and the the inform
 5804:     ?DBG("ma_v2_inform -> await inform",[]),
 5805:     ?expect2({inform,true}, [{[sysUpTime,0], any},
 5806: 				   {[snmpTrapOID,0],?authenticationFailure}]).
 5807: 
 5808: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5809: std_mib_a() ->
 5810:     [InPkts] = get_req(2, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5811:     [InPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5812:     InPkts2 = InPkts + 1,
 5813: 
 5814:     [InBadVsns] = get_req(4, [[snmpInBadVersions,0]]),
 5815:     InBadVsns.
 5816: 
 5817: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5818: std_mib_b(InBadVsns) ->
 5819:     [InBadVsns2] = get_req(1, [[snmpInBadVersions,0]]),
 5820:     InBadVsns2 = InBadVsns + 1,
 5821:     [InPkts] = get_req(2, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5822:     [InPkts2] = get_req(3, [[snmpInPkts,0]]),
 5823:     InPkts2 = InPkts + 1,
 5824:     [InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs] =
 5825: 	get_req(4, [[snmpInBadCommunityNames,0],
 5826: 		    [snmpInBadCommunityUses,0],
 5827: 		    [snmpInASNParseErrs, 0]]),
 5828:     {InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs}.
 5829:     
 5830: %% Req. SNMP-STANDARD-MIB | SNMPv2-MIB
 5831: std_mib_c({InBadCommunityNames, InBadCommunityUses, InASNErrs}) ->
 5832:     [InBadCommunityNames2, InBadCommunityUses2, InASNErrs2] =
 5833: 	get_req(1, [[snmpInBadCommunityNames,0],
 5834: 		    [snmpInBadCommunityUses,0],
 5835: 		    [snmpInASNParseErrs, 0]]),
 5836:     InBadCommunityNames2 = InBadCommunityNames + 1,
 5837:     InBadCommunityUses2 = InBadCommunityUses + 1,
 5838:     InASNErrs2 = InASNErrs + 1.
 5839: 
 5840: %% Req. SNMPv2-MIB
 5841: snmpv2_mib_a() ->
 5842:     [SetSerial] = get_req(2, [[snmpSetSerialNo,0]]),
 5843:     s([{[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}, {[sysLocation, 0], "val2"}]),
 5844:     ?expect1([{[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial},
 5845: 		    {[sysLocation, 0], "val2"}]),
 5846:     s([{[sysLocation, 0], "val3"}, {[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}]),
 5847:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 2,
 5848: 		   [{[sysLocation, 0], "val3"},
 5849: 		    {[snmpSetSerialNo,0], SetSerial}]),
 5850:     ["val2"] = get_req(5, [[sysLocation,0]]),
 5851:     ok.
 5852:

 5892: %% Req. SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB
 5893: %% snmpEngineTime (in number of seconds).
 5894: %% In theory, the Engine Time diff of the engine, should be exactly
 5895: %% the same as the number of seconds we sleep (5 in this case).
 5896: %% But because, on some (slow or/and high loaded) hosts, the actual
 5897: %% time we sleep could be a lot larger (due to, for instance, scheduling).
 5898: %% Therefore we must take that into account when we check if the 
 5899: %% Engine Time diff (between the two checks) is acceptably.
 5900: snmp_framework_mib_test() ->
 5901: 
 5902:     ?IPRINT("transports: "
 5903:             "~n      ~p"
 5904:             "~ninfo: "
 5905:             "~n      ~p",
 5906:             [
 5907:              rpc:call(get(master_node), snmpa, which_transports, []),
 5908:              rpc:call(get(master_node), snmpa, info, [])
 5909:             ]),
 5910: 
 5911:     Sleep = 5,
 5912:     ["agentEngine"] = get_req(1, [[snmpEngineID,0]]),
 5913:     T1 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5914:     [EngineTime] = get_req(2, [[snmpEngineTime,0]]),
 5915:     T2 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5916:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(Sleep)),
 5917:     T3 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5918:     [EngineTime2] = get_req(3, [[snmpEngineTime,0]]),
 5919:     T4 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5920: 
 5921:     %% Ok, we tried to sleep 5 seconds, but how long did we actually sleep
 5922:     ASleep         = ((T3-T2) + 500) div 1000,
 5923:     EngineTimeDiff = EngineTime2 - EngineTime,
 5924:     HighEngineTime = EngineTime + ASleep + 2,
 5925:     LowEngineTime  = EngineTime + ASleep - 1,
 5926: 
 5927:     ?IPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> time(s): "
 5928:             "~n   EngineTime 1:                         ~p"
 5929:             "~n      Time to acquire:                   ~w msec"
 5930:             "~n   EngineTime 2:                         ~p"
 5931:             "~n      Time to acquire:                   ~w msec"
 5932:             "~n   => Total time to acquire:             ~w msec"
 5933:             "~n      Sleep between get(snmpEngineTime): ~w (~w) sec"
 5934:             "~n      Engine Time Diff:                  ~w sec"
 5935:             "~n      Success if:"
 5936:             "~n           ~w (low) =< Engine Time 2 =< ~w (high)",
 5937:             [EngineTime, T2-T1, 
 5938:              EngineTime2, T4-T3,
 5939:              T4-T1, ASleep, Sleep, EngineTimeDiff, LowEngineTime, HighEngineTime]),
 5940: 
 5941:     %% In our environment, get'ing the snmpEngineTime should only take
 5942:     %% a couple of milli sec (less then 100).
 5943:     %% So just as a sanity check, we check that it its < 1000ms.
 5944:     %% We do have a couple of machines that are "unstable"...
 5945: 
 5946:     ?IPRINT("check that all snmpEngineTime acquire < 1000"),
 5947:     if
 5948:         ((T2 - T1) >= 1000) ->
 5949:             ?WPRINT("Failed snmpEngineTime 1 sanity check: "
 5950:                     "~n      Time to acquire ~w >= 1000", [T2-T1]),
 5951:             ?SKIP({acquire, snmpEngineTime, 1, T1, T2});
 5952:         ((T4 - T3) >= 1000) ->
 5953:             ?WPRINT("Failed snmpEngineTime 2 sanity check: "
 5954:                     "~n      Time to acquire ~w >= 1000", [T4-T3]),
 5955:             ?SKIP({acquire, snmpEngineTime, 2, T3, T4});
 5956:         true ->
 5957:             ok
 5958:     end,
 5959: 
 5960:     if
 5961:         (HighEngineTime < EngineTime2) ->
 5962:             ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> (High) Engine Time diff (~w) too large: "
 5963:                     "~n      ~w < ~w",
 5964:                     [EngineTimeDiff, HighEngineTime, EngineTime2]),
 5965:             ?FAIL({too_large_diff, EngineTime, EngineTime2});
 5966:         (LowEngineTime > EngineTime2) ->
 5967:              ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> (Low) Engine Time diff (~w) too large: "
 5968:                     "~n      ~w > ~w",
 5969:                     [EngineTimeDiff, LowEngineTime, EngineTime2]),
 5970:             ?FAIL({too_large_diff, EngineTime, EngineTime2});
 5971:         true -> 
 5972:             ok
 5973:     end,
 5974: 
 5975:     T5 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5976:     case get_req(4, [[snmpEngineBoots,0]]) of
 5977: 	      [Boots] when is_integer(Boots) -> 
 5978:                   T6 = snmp_misc:now(ms),
 5979:                   ?IPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> "
 5980:                           "~n   boots: ~p"
 5981:                           "~n      Time to acquire: ~w ms", [Boots, T6-T5]),
 5982: 		  ok;
 5983: 	      Else -> 
 5984:                   ?EPRINT("snmp_framework_mib -> failed get proper boots:"
 5985:                           "~n   ~p", [Else]),
 5986: 		  ?FAIL({invalid_boots, Else})
 5987: 	  end,
 5988:     ok.
 5989:

 5993: snmp_mpd_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 5994:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5995:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 5996:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 5997:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 5998:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 5999: 
 6000:     ?P(snmp_mpd_mib_3), 
 6001:     init_case(Config),
 6002:     UnknownPDUHs = try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_a),
 6003:     try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_b, [], [{context_engine_id, "bad engine"}]),
 6004:     try_test(snmp_mpd_mib_c, [UnknownPDUHs]).
 6005:

 6007: %% Req. SNMP-MPD-MIB
 6008: snmp_mpd_mib_a() ->
 6009:     [UnknownSecs, InvalidMsgs] =
 6010: 	get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownSecurityModels,0],
 6011: 		    [snmpInvalidMsgs,0]]),
 6012:     Pdu = #pdu{type = 'get-request',
 6013: 	       request_id = 23,
 6014: 	       error_status = noError,
 6015: 	       error_index = 0,
 6016: 	       varbinds = []},
 6017:     SPdu = #scopedPdu{contextEngineID = "agentEngine",
 6018: 		      contextName = "",
 6019: 		      data = Pdu},
 6020:     SPDUBytes = snmp_pdus:enc_scoped_pdu(SPdu),
 6021:     V3Hdr1 = #v3_hdr{msgID = 21,
 6022: 		     msgMaxSize = 484,
 6023: 		     msgFlags = [7],
 6024: 		     msgSecurityModel = 23,  % bad sec model
 6025: 		     msgSecurityParameters = []},
 6026:     V3Hdr2 = #v3_hdr{msgID = 21,
 6027: 		     msgMaxSize = 484,
 6028: 		     msgFlags = [6], % bad flag combination
 6029: 		     msgSecurityModel = 3,
 6030: 		     msgSecurityParameters = []},
 6031:     Message1 = #message{version = 'version-3', vsn_hdr = V3Hdr1,
 6032: 			data = SPDUBytes},
 6033:     Message2 = #message{version = 'version-3', vsn_hdr = V3Hdr2,
 6034: 			data = SPDUBytes},
 6035:     MsgBytes1 = snmp_pdus:enc_message_only(Message1),
 6036:     MsgBytes2 = snmp_pdus:enc_message_only(Message2),
 6037:     snmp_test_mgr:send_bytes(MsgBytes1),
 6038:     snmp_test_mgr:send_bytes(MsgBytes2),
 6039: 
 6040:     [UnknownSecs2, InvalidMsgs2, UnknownPDUHs] =
 6041: 	get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownSecurityModels,0],
 6042: 		    [snmpInvalidMsgs,0],
 6043: 		    [snmpUnknownPDUHandlers, 0]]),
 6044:     UnknownSecs2 = UnknownSecs + 1,
 6045:     InvalidMsgs2 = InvalidMsgs + 1,
 6046:     UnknownPDUHs.
 6047: 
 6048: -define(snmpUnknownPDUHandlers_instance, [1,3,6,1,6,3,11,2,1,3,0]).
 6049: snmp_mpd_mib_b() ->
 6050:     g([[sysUpTime,0]]),
 6051:     ?expect2(report, [{?snmpUnknownPDUHandlers_instance, any}]).
 6052:     
 6053: 
 6054: snmp_mpd_mib_c(UnknownPDUHs) ->
 6055:     [UnknownPDUHs2] = get_req(1, [[snmpUnknownPDUHandlers, 0]]),
 6056:     UnknownPDUHs2 = UnknownPDUHs + 1,
 6057:     ok.

 6093: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6094: %% o  add/delete views and try them
 6095: %% o  try boundaries
 6096: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6097: snmp_view_based_acm_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6098:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib), 
 6099:     init_case(Config),
 6100: 
 6101:     load_master_std("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6102:     load_master("Test2"),
 6103:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(),
 6104:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6105:     unload_master("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB").
 6106: 
 6107: snmp_view_based_acm_mib_2(X) -> 
 6108:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib_2), 
 6109:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(X).
 6110: 
 6111: snmp_view_based_acm_mib_3(X) -> 
 6112:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6113:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 6114:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 6115:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(X, Condition),
 6116:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6117: 
 6118:     ?P(snmp_view_based_acm_mib_3), 
 6119:     snmp_view_based_acm_mib(X).
 6120: 
 6121: snmp_view_based_acm_mib() ->
 6122:     snmpa:verbosity(net_if,trace),
 6123:     snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,trace),
 6124:     ?IPRINT("start snmp_view_based_acm_mib test"),
 6125:     %% The user "no-rights" is present in USM, and is mapped to security
 6126:     %% name 'no-rights", which is not present in VACM.
 6127:     %% So, we'll add rights for it, try them and delete them.
 6128:     %% We'll give "no-rights" write access to tDescr.0 and read access
 6129:     %% to tDescr2.0
 6130:     %% These are the options we'll use to the mgr
 6131:     Opts = [{user, "no-rights"}, {community, "no-rights"}],
 6132:     %% Find the valid secmodel, and one invalid secmodel.
 6133:     {SecMod, InvSecMod} = 
 6134: 	case get(vsn) of
 6135: 	    v1 -> {?SEC_V1, ?SEC_V2C};
 6136: 	    v2 -> {?SEC_V2C, ?SEC_USM};
 6137: 	    v3 -> {?SEC_USM, ?SEC_V1}
 6138: 	end,
 6139:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6140:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6141: 
 6142:     %% Now, add a mapping from "no-rights" -> "no-rights-group"
 6143:     GRow1Status = [vacmSecurityToGroupStatus,[SecMod, 9,"no-rights"]],
 6144:     GRow1 = 
 6145: 	[{[vacmGroupName, [SecMod, 9,"no-rights"]], "no-rights-group"},
 6146: 	 {GRow1Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6147:     ?DBG("set '~p'",[GRow1]),
 6148:     try_test(do_set, [GRow1]),
 6149: 
 6150:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6151:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6152: 
 6153:     %% Create a mapping for another sec model, and make sure it doesn't
 6154:     %% give us access
 6155:     GRow2Status = [vacmSecurityToGroupStatus,[InvSecMod, 9,"no-rights"]],
 6156:     GRow2 = [{[vacmGroupName, [InvSecMod, 9, "no-rights"]], "initial"},
 6157: 	     {GRow2Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6158: 
 6159:     ?DBG("set '~p'",[GRow2]),
 6160:     try_test(do_set, [GRow2]),
 6161: 
 6162:     ?DBG("assign rights for 'no-rights'",[]),
 6163:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6164: 
 6165:     %% Delete that row
 6166:     try_test(del_row, [GRow2Status]),
 6167:     
 6168:     RVName = "rv_name",
 6169:     WVName = "wv_name",
 6170: 
 6171:     %% Access row
 6172:     ARow1Idx = [15 | "no-rights-group"] ++ [0, ?SEC_ANY, 1],
 6173:     ARow1Status = [vacmAccessStatus, ARow1Idx],
 6174:     ARow1 = [{[vacmAccessContextMatch, ARow1Idx], 1},
 6175: 	     {[vacmAccessReadViewName, ARow1Idx], RVName},
 6176: 	     {[vacmAccessWriteViewName, ARow1Idx], WVName},
 6177: 	     {ARow1Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6178:     
 6179:     %% This access row would give access, if InvSecMod was valid.
 6180:     ARow2Idx = [15 | "no-rights-group"] ++ [0, InvSecMod, 1],
 6181:     ARow2Status = [vacmAccessStatus, ARow2Idx],
 6182:     ARow2 = [{[vacmAccessContextMatch, ARow2Idx], 1},
 6183: 	     {[vacmAccessReadViewName, ARow2Idx], "internet"},
 6184: 	     {[vacmAccessWriteViewName, ARow2Idx], "internet"},
 6185: 	     {ARow2Status, ?createAndGo}],
 6186:     
 6187:     try_test(do_set, [ARow2]),
 6188: 
 6189:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6190: 
 6191:     %% Delete that row
 6192:     try_test(del_row, [ARow2Status]),
 6193:     
 6194: 
 6195:     %% Add valid row
 6196:     try_test(do_set, [ARow1]),
 6197: 
 6198:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6199: 
 6200:     %% Create the view family
 6201:     VRow1Idx = mk_ln(RVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr),         % object access
 6202:     VRow2Idx = mk_ln(RVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr2 ++ [0]), % instance access
 6203:     VRow3Idx = mk_ln(WVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr),         % object access
 6204:     VRow4Idx = mk_ln(WVName) ++ mk_ln(?xDescr ++ [0]),  % instance access
 6205:     VRow1Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow1Idx],
 6206:     VRow2Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow2Idx],
 6207:     VRow3Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow3Idx],
 6208:     VRow4Status = [vacmViewTreeFamilyStatus, VRow4Idx],
 6209:     
 6210:     try_test(add_row, [VRow1Status]),
 6211:     try_test(add_row, [VRow2Status]),
 6212:     try_test(add_row, [VRow3Status]),
 6213: 
 6214:     %% We're supposed to have access now...
 6215:     try_test(use_rights, [], Opts),
 6216: 
 6217:     %% Change Row3 to Row4
 6218:     try_test(del_row, [VRow3Status]),
 6219:     try_test(add_row, [VRow4Status]),
 6220: 
 6221:     %% We should still have access...
 6222:     try_test(use_rights, [], Opts),
 6223: 
 6224:     %% Delete rows
 6225:     try_test(del_row, [GRow1Status]),
 6226:     
 6227:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6228: 
 6229:     %% Delete rest of rows
 6230:     try_test(del_row, [ARow1Status]),
 6231:     try_test(del_row, [VRow1Status]),
 6232:     try_test(del_row, [VRow2Status]),
 6233:     try_test(del_row, [VRow4Status]),
 6234: 
 6235:     try_test(use_no_rights, [], Opts),
 6236:     snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,log).
 6237: 
 6238: do_set(Row) ->
 6239:     s(Row),
 6240:     ?expect1(Row).
 6241:     
 6242: add_row(RowStatus) ->
 6243:     s([{RowStatus, ?createAndGo}]),
 6244:     ?expect1([{RowStatus, ?createAndGo}]).
 6245: 
 6246: del_row(RowStatus) ->
 6247:     s([{RowStatus, ?destroy}]),
 6248:     ?expect1([{RowStatus, ?destroy}]).
 6249:     
 6250:     
 6251: 
 6252: use_no_rights() ->
 6253:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6254:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6255: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], noSuchObject}]),
 6256: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6257:     g([[xDescr2,0]]),
 6258:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6259: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr2,0], noSuchObject}]),
 6260: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6261:     gn([[xDescr]]),
 6262:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6263: 	    ?expect1([{[xDescr], endOfMibView}]),
 6264: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)),
 6265:     s([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]),
 6266:     ?v1_2_3(?expect3(noSuchName, 1, any),
 6267: 	    ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6268: 	    ?expect3(authorizationError, 1, any)).
 6269: 
 6270: 
 6271: use_rights() ->
 6272:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6273:     ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], any}]),
 6274:     g([[xDescr2,0]]),
 6275:     ?expect1([{[xDescr2,0], any}]),
 6276:     s([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]),
 6277:     ?expect3(noError, 0, any),
 6278:     g([[xDescr,0]]),
 6279:     ?expect1([{[xDescr,0], "tryit"}]).
 6280: 
 6281: mk_ln(X) ->
 6282:     [length(X) | X].
 6283: 
 6284: 
 6285: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6286: %% o  add/delete users and try them
 6287: %% o  test all secLevels
 6288: %% o  test all combinations of protocols
 6289: %% o  try bad ops; check counters
 6290: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6291: snmp_user_based_sm_mib_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6292:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6293:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin]}],
 6294:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 6295:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(Config, Condition),
 6296:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6297: 
 6298:     ?P(snmp_user_based_sm_mib_3), 
 6299:     init_case(Config),
 6300: 
 6301:     _AgentDir = ?config(agent_conf_dir, Config),
 6302:     load_master_std("SNMP-USER-BASED-SM-MIB"),
 6303: 
 6304:     %% The newUser used here already has VACM access.
 6305:     
 6306:     %% Add a new user in the simplest way; just createAndGo
 6307:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_add_user1, []}]],
 6308: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6309: 
 6310:     %% Try to use the new user
 6311:     load_master("Test2"),
 6312:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6313: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6314:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6315: 
 6316:     ShaKey1 = snmp:passwd2localized_key(sha, "new sha password", "agentEngine"),
 6317:     DesKey1 = lists:sublist(ShaKey1, 16),
 6318: 
 6319:     %% Change the new user's keys - 1
 6320:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_key_change1, [ShaKey1, DesKey1]}]],
 6321: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6322: 
 6323:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6324:     MgrDir = ?config(mgr_dir, Config),
 6325:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey1, DesKey1),
 6326:     load_master("Test2"),
 6327:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6328: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6329:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6330: 
 6331:     ShaKey2 = snmp:passwd2localized_key(sha, "newer password", "agentEngine"),
 6332:     DesKey2 = lists:sublist(ShaKey2, 16),
 6333: 
 6334:     %% Change the new user's keys - 2
 6335:     try_test(v3_sync,
 6336: 	      [[{usm_key_change2, [ShaKey1, DesKey1, ShaKey2, DesKey2]}]],
 6337: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6338: 
 6339:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6340:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6341:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey2, DesKey2),
 6342:     load_master("Test2"),
 6343:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6344: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6345:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6346:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6347: 
 6348:     %% Change the new user's keys - 3
 6349:     try_test(v3_sync,
 6350: 	      [[{usm_key_change3, [ShaKey2, DesKey2, ShaKey1, DesKey1]}]],
 6351: 	      [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6352: 
 6353:     %% Try to use the new keys
 6354:     rewrite_usm_mgr(MgrDir, ShaKey1, DesKey1),
 6355:     load_master("Test2"),
 6356:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_use_user, []}]],
 6357: 	[{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "newUser"}]),
 6358:     unload_master("Test2"),
 6359:     reset_usm_mgr(MgrDir),
 6360: 
 6361:     %% Try some read requests
 6362:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_read, []}]],
 6363: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6364: 
 6365:     %% Delete the new user
 6366:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_del_user, []}]],
 6367: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6368: 
 6369:     %% Try some bad requests
 6370:     try_test(v3_sync, [[{usm_bad, []}]],
 6371: 		   [{sec_level, authPriv}, {user, "privDES"}]),
 6372: 
 6373:     unload_master("SNMP-USER-BASED-SM-MIB").
 6374: 
 6375: -define(usmUserSecurityName, [1,3,6,1,6,3,15,1,2,2,1,3]).
 6376: 
 6377: usm_add_user1() ->
 6378:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6379:     RowPointer = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6380:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer},
 6381: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6382:     s(Vbs1),
 6383:     ?expect1(Vbs1),
 6384:     ok.
 6385:     
 6386: usm_use_user() ->
 6387:     v2_proc().
 6388: 
 6389: 
 6390: %% Change own public keys
 6391: usm_key_change1(ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6392:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6393:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6394: 							"passwd_shaxxxxxxxxxx",
 6395: 							ShaKey),
 6396:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6397: 							"passwd_desxxxxxx",
 6398: 							DesKey),
 6399:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6400: 	    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6401:     s(Vbs1),
 6402:     ?expect1(Vbs1).
 6403:     
 6404: %% Change own private keys
 6405: usm_key_change2(OldShaKey, OldDesKey, ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6406:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6407:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6408: 							OldShaKey,
 6409: 							ShaKey),
 6410:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6411: 							OldDesKey,
 6412: 							DesKey),
 6413:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6414: 	    {[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6415:     s(Vbs1),
 6416:     ?expect1(Vbs1).
 6417:     
 6418: %% Change other's public keys
 6419: usm_key_change3(OldShaKey, OldDesKey, ShaKey, DesKey) ->
 6420:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6421:     ShaKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6422: 							OldShaKey,
 6423: 							ShaKey),
 6424:     DesKeyChange = snmp_user_based_sm_mib:mk_key_change(sha,
 6425: 							OldDesKey,
 6426: 							DesKey),
 6427:     Vbs1 = [{[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange}],
 6428:     s(Vbs1),
 6429:     ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6430:     Vbs2 = [{[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6431:     s(Vbs2),
 6432:     ?expect3(noAccess, 1, any),
 6433:     
 6434:     
 6435:     Vbs3 = [{[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ShaKeyChange},
 6436: 	    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], DesKeyChange}],
 6437:     s(Vbs3),
 6438:     ?expect1(Vbs3),
 6439:     ok.
 6440: 
 6441: usm_read() ->
 6442:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6443:     g([[usmUserSecurityName, NewRowIndex],
 6444: 	     [usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex],
 6445: 	     [usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6446: 	     [usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6447: 	     [usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex],
 6448: 	     [usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex]]),
 6449:     ?expect1([{[usmUserSecurityName, NewRowIndex], "newUser"},
 6450: 		    {[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], [0,0]},
 6451: 		    {[usmUserAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6452: 		    {[usmUserOwnAuthKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6453: 		    {[usmUserPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""},
 6454: 		    {[usmUserOwnPrivKeyChange, NewRowIndex], ""}]),
 6455:     ok.
 6456:     
 6457:     
 6458: 
 6459: usm_del_user() ->
 6460:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6461:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?destroy}],
 6462:     s(Vbs1),
 6463:     ?expect1(Vbs1),
 6464:     ok.
 6465: 
 6466: -define(usmUserCloneFrom, [1,3,6,1,6,3,15,1,2,2,1,4]).
 6467: 
 6468: -define(usmNoAuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,1]).
 6469: 
 6470: -define(usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,2]).
 6471: 
 6472: -define(usmHMACSHAAuthProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,1,3]).
 6473: 
 6474: -define(usmNoPrivProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,2,1]).
 6475: 
 6476: -define(usmDESPrivProtocol, [1,3,6,1,6,3,10,1,2,2]).
 6477: 
 6478: usm_bad() ->
 6479:     NewRowIndex = [11,"agentEngine", 7, "newUser"],
 6480:     RowPointer1 = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDOS"],
 6481:     Vbs1  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer1},
 6482: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6483:     s(Vbs1),
 6484:     ?expect3(inconsistentName, 1, any),
 6485: 
 6486:     RowPointer2 = ?usmUserCloneFrom ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6487:     Vbs2  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer2},
 6488: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6489:     s(Vbs2),
 6490:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6491: 
 6492:     RowPointer3 = ?usmUserSecurityName ++ [11|"agentEngine"] ++ [7|"privDES"],
 6493:     Vbs3  = [{[usmUserCloneFrom, NewRowIndex], RowPointer3},
 6494: 	     {[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?createAndGo}],
 6495:     s(Vbs3),
 6496:     ?expect1(Vbs3),
 6497:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmNoAuthProtocol}]),
 6498:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 1, any),
 6499:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmHMACMD5AuthProtocol}]),
 6500:     ?expect3(inconsistentValue, 1, any),
 6501:     s([{[usmUserAuthProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmDESPrivProtocol}]),
 6502:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6503:     s([{[usmUserPrivProtocol, NewRowIndex], ?usmHMACSHAAuthProtocol}]),
 6504:     ?expect3(wrongValue, 1, any),
 6505: 
 6506:     Vbs4  = [{[usmUserStatus, NewRowIndex], ?destroy}],
 6507:     s(Vbs4),
 6508:     ?expect1(Vbs4),
 6509:     ok.
 6510:     
 6511: 
 6512: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6513: %% Loop through entire MIB, to make sure that all instrum. funcs
 6514: %% works.
 6515: %% Load all std mibs that are not loaded by default.
 6516: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 6517: loop_mib_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6518:     ?P(loop_mib_1),
 6519:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1 -> initiate case"),
 6520: 
 6521:     {_SaNode, _MgrNode, _MibDir} = init_case(Config),
 6522:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> ~n"
 6523: 	   "\tSaNode:  ~p~n"
 6524: 	   "\tMgrNode: ~p~n"
 6525: 	   "\tMibDir:  ~p",[_SaNode, _MgrNode, _MibDir]),
 6526:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB",[]),
 6527:     load_master_std("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6528:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-MPD-MIB",[]),
 6529:     load_master_std("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6530:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-TARGET-MIB",[]),
 6531:     load_master_std("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6532:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB",[]),
 6533:     load_master_std("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6534:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB",[]),
 6535:     load_master_std("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6536:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> load mib SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB",[]),
 6537:     load_master_std("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6538:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> try",[]),
 6539: 
 6540:     try_test(loop_mib_1_test),
 6541: 
 6542:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB",[]),
 6543:     unload_master("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6544:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-MPD-MIB",[]),
 6545:     unload_master("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6546:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-TARGET-MIB",[]),
 6547:     unload_master("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6548:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB",[]),
 6549:     unload_master("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6550:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB",[]),
 6551:     unload_master("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6552:     ?DBG("loop_mib_1 -> unload mib SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB",[]),
 6553:     unload_master("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6554:     %% snmpa:verbosity(master_agent,log),
 6555:     %% snmpa:verbosity(mib_server,silence),
 6556:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1 -> done"),
 6557:     ok.
 6558:     
 6559: 
 6560: loop_mib_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 6561:     ?P(loop_mib_2), 
 6562:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_2 -> initiate case"),

 6564:     ?DBG("do_loop_mib_2 -> ~n"
 6565: 	   "\tSaNode:  ~p~n"
 6566: 	   "\tMgrNode: ~p~n"
 6567: 	   "\tMibDir:  ~p", [_SaNode, _MgrNode, _MibDir]),
 6568:     ?DBG("loop_mib_2 -> load mibs",[]),
 6569:     load_master_std("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6570:     load_master_std("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6571:     load_master_std("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6572:     load_master_std("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6573:     load_master_std("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6574:     load_master_std("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),

 6578:     ?DBG("loop_mib_2 -> unload mibs",[]),
 6579:     unload_master("SNMP-COMMUNITY-MIB"),
 6580:     unload_master("SNMP-MPD-MIB"),
 6581:     unload_master("SNMP-TARGET-MIB"),
 6582:     unload_master("SNMP-NOTIFICATION-MIB"),
 6583:     unload_master("SNMP-FRAMEWORK-MIB"),
 6584:     unload_master("SNMP-VIEW-BASED-ACM-MIB"),
 6585:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_2 -> done"),
 6586:     ok.

 6613: 
 6614: %% Req. As many mibs all possible
 6615: loop_mib_1_test() ->
 6616:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_1_test -> entry"),
 6617:     N = loop_it_1([1,1], 0),
 6618:     ?IPRINT("found ~w variables", [N]),
 6619:     N = if N < 100 -> 100;
 6620: 		 true -> N
 6621: 	      end.
 6622: 
 6623: loop_it_1(Oid, N) ->
 6624:     ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> entry with"
 6625:             "~n      Oid: ~p"
 6626:             "~n      N:   ~p", [Oid, N]),
 6627:     case get_next_req([Oid]) of
 6628: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6629: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6630: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6631: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid   = NOid,
 6632: 				      value = _Value}]} when NOid > Oid ->
 6633: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> "
 6634:                     "expected intermediate (get-next) result: "
 6635:                     "~n   NOid:  ~p"
 6636:                     "~n   Value: ~p", [NOid, _Value]),
 6637: 	    [_Value2] = get_req(1, [NOid]), % must not be same
 6638: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> expected intermediate (get) result: "
 6639:                     "~n   Value2: ~p", [_Value2]),
 6640: 	    loop_it_1(NOid, N+1);
 6641: 
 6642: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6643: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6644: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6645: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6646:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected (get-response) vbs: "
 6647:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Vbs]),
 6648: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_vbs,
 6649:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid}, 
 6650:                           {counter,      N},
 6651:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6652: 
 6653: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6654: 	     error_status = noSuchName, 
 6655: 	     error_index = 1,
 6656: 	     varbinds    = [_]} ->
 6657: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> done: ~p", [N]),
 6658: 	    N;
 6659: 
 6660: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6661: 	     error_status = Err, 
 6662: 	     error_index  = Idx,
 6663: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6664:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected (get-response) pdu: "
 6665:                     "~n      Err: ~p"
 6666:                     "~n      Idx: ~p"
 6667:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Err, Idx, Vbs]),
 6668: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6669:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6670:                           {counter,      N},
 6671:                           {error_status, Err},
 6672:                           {error_index,  Idx},
 6673:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6674: 
 6675: 	#pdu{type         = Type, 
 6676: 	     error_status = Err, 
 6677: 	     error_index  = Idx,
 6678: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6679:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> unexpected pdu: "
 6680:                     "~n      Type: ~p"
 6681:                     "~n      Err:  ~p"
 6682:                     "~n      Idx:  ~p"
 6683:                     "~n      Vbs:  ~p", [Type, Err, Idx, Vbs]),
 6684: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6685:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6686:                           {counter,      N},
 6687:                           {type,         Type},
 6688:                           {error_status, Err},
 6689:                           {error_index,  Idx},
 6690:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6691: 
 6692: 	{error, Reason} ->
 6693:             %% Regardless of the error here (its usually timeout),
 6694:             %% if we have had system events we skip since the results
 6695:             %% in those cases are simply not reliable.
 6696:             %% There is just no point in trying to analyze the reason.
 6697:             ?IPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> receive error: "
 6698:                     "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6699:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 6700:             if
 6701:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 6702:                     ?EPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> error: "
 6703:                             "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6704:                     ?FAIL([{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6705:                                  {counter,      N},
 6706:                                  {reason,       Reason}]);
 6707: 
 6708:                         true ->
 6709:                     ?WPRINT("loop_it_1_test -> "
 6710:                             "error when we got system events: "
 6711:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 6712:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 6713:                             "~n", [Reason, SysEvs]),
 6714:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 6715:             end
 6716:     end.
 6717: 	    
 6718: 
 6719: %% Req. As many mibs as possible
 6720: loop_mib_2_test() ->
 6721:     ?IPRINT("loop_mib_2_test -> entry"),
 6722:     N = loop_it_2([1,1], 0),
 6723:     ?IPRINT("found ~w variables", [N]),
 6724:     N = if N < 100 -> 100;
 6725: 		 true -> N
 6726: 	      end.
 6727: 
 6728: loop_it_2(Oid, N) ->
 6729:     ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> entry with"
 6730:             "~n   Oid: ~p"
 6731:             "~n   N:   ~p", [Oid, N]),
 6732:     case get_next_req([Oid]) of
 6733: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6734: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6735: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6736: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid = _NOid, value = endOfMibView}]} ->
 6737: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> done: "
 6738:                     "~n   NOid: ~p", [_NOid]),
 6739: 	    N;
 6740: 
 6741: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6742: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6743: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6744: 	     varbinds     = [#varbind{oid   = NOid,
 6745: 				      value = _Value}]} when NOid > Oid ->
 6746: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> "
 6747:                     "expected intermediate (get-next) result: "
 6748:                     "~n   NOid:  ~p"
 6749:                     "~n   Value: ~p", [NOid, _Value]),
 6750: 	    [_Value2] = get_req(1, [NOid]), % must not be same
 6751: 	    ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> expected intermediate (get) result: "
 6752:                     "~n   Value2: ~p", [_Value2]),
 6753: 	    loop_it_2(NOid, N+1);
 6754: 
 6755: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6756: 	     error_status = noError, 
 6757: 	     error_index  = 0,
 6758: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6759:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected (get-response) vbs: "
 6760:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [Vbs]),
 6761: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_vbs,
 6762:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6763:                           {counter,      N},
 6764:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6765: 
 6766: 	#pdu{type         = 'get-response', 
 6767: 	     error_status = ES, 
 6768: 	     error_index  = EI,
 6769: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6770:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected (get-response) pdu: "
 6771:                     "~n      ES:  ~p"
 6772:                     "~n      EI:  ~p"
 6773:                     "~n      Vbs: ~p", [ES, EI, Vbs]),
 6774: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6775:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6776:                           {counter,      N},
 6777:                           {error_status, ES}, 
 6778:                           {error_index,  EI},
 6779:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6780: 
 6781: 	#pdu{type         = Type, 
 6782: 	     error_status = ES, 
 6783: 	     error_index  = EI,
 6784: 	     varbinds     = Vbs} ->
 6785:             ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> unexpected pdu: "
 6786:                     "~n      Type: ~p"
 6787:                     "~n      ES:   ~p"
 6788:                     "~n      EI:   ~p"
 6789:                     "~n      Vbs:  ~p", [Type, ES, EI, Vbs]),
 6790: 	    ?FAIL({unexpected_pdu,
 6791:                          [{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6792:                           {counter,      N},
 6793:                           {type,         Type}, 
 6794:                           {error_status, ES}, 
 6795:                           {error_index,  EI},
 6796:                           {varbinds,     Vbs}]});
 6797: 
 6798: 	{error, Reason} ->
 6799:             %% Regardless of the error here (its usually timeout),
 6800:             %% if we have had system events we skip since the results
 6801:             %% in those cases are simply not reliable.
 6802:             %% There is just no point in trying to analyze the reason.
 6803:             ?IPRINT("loop_it_2 -> receive error: "
 6804:                     "~n      ~p", [Reason]),
 6805:             SysEvs = snmp_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
 6806:             if
 6807:                 (SysEvs =:= []) ->
 6808:                     ?EPRINT("loop_it_2 -> error *without* system events: "
 6809:                             "~n   Oid:    ~p"
 6810:                             "~n   N:      ~p"
 6811:                             "~n   Reason: ~p", [Oid, N,Reason]),
 6812:                     ?FAIL([{get_next_oid, Oid},
 6813:                            {counter,      N},
 6814:                            {reason,       Reason}]);
 6815: 
 6816:                 true ->
 6817:                     ?WPRINT("loop_it_2 -> "
 6818:                             "error *with* system events: "
 6819:                             "~n   Oid:        ~p"
 6820:                             "~n   N:          ~p"
 6821:                             "~n   Reason:     ~p"
 6822:                             "~n   Sys Events: ~p"
 6823:                             "~n", [Oid, N, Reason, SysEvs]),
 6824:                     ?SKIP([{reason, Reason}, {system_events, SysEvs}])
 6825:             end
 6826:     end.
 6827: 	    
 6828: loop_mib_3_test() ->
 6829:     ?DBG("loop_mib_3_test -> entry",[]),
 6830:     loop_mib_2_test().

 6967: otp_1131_3(X) -> 
 6968:     %% <CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 6969:     %% This is intended to catch Montavista Linux 4.0/ppc (2.6.5)
 6970:     %% Montavista Linux looks like a Debian distro (/etc/issue)
 6971:     LinuxVersionVerify = 
 6972: 	fun() ->
 6973: 		case string:to_lower(os:cmd("uname -m")) of
 6974: 		    "ppc" ++ _ ->
 6975: 			case file:read_file_info("/etc/issue") of
 6976: 			    {ok, _} ->
 6977: 				case string:to_lower(
 6978:                                        os:cmd("grep -i montavista /etc/issue")) of
 6979: 				    "montavista" ++ _ ->
 6980: 					case os:version() of
 6981: 					    {2, 6, 10} ->
 6982:                                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) kernel version check: "
 6983:                                                         "{2, 6, 10} => SKIP"),
 6984: 						true;
 6985: 					    V ->
 6986:                                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) kernel version check: "
 6987:                                                         "~p != {2, 6, 10} => *NO* SKIP", [V]),
 6988: 						false
 6989: 					end;
 6990: 				    _ -> % Maybe plain Debian or Ubuntu
 6991:                                         ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) Not MontaVista => *NO* SKIP"),
 6992: 					false
 6993: 				end;
 6994: 			    _ ->
 6995: 				%% Not a Debian based distro
 6996:                                 ?IPRINT("(PPC Linux) Unknown distro => *NO* SKIP"),
 6997: 				false
 6998: 			end;
 6999: 		    _ ->
 7000:                         ?IPRINT("(Linux) Not PPC => *NO* SKIP"),
 7001: 			false
 7002: 		end
 7003: 	end,
 7004:     Skippable = [{unix, [darwin, {linux, LinuxVersionVerify}]}],
 7005:     Condition = fun() -> ?OS_BASED_SKIP(Skippable) end,
 7006:     ?NON_PC_TC_MAYBE_SKIP(X, Condition),
 7007:     %% </CONDITIONAL-SKIP>
 7008: 
 7009:     ?P(otp_1131_3), 
 7010:     otp_1131(X).
 7011:

 7230: validate_dat(L) -> validate_dat(L,[]).
 7231:  
 7232: validate_dat([],V) ->

 7234:                         ok -> false;
 7235:                         _  -> true
 7236:                       end
 7237:         end,
 7238:   validate_dat1( lists:reverse( lists:filter(Fun,V) ) );

 7240:   validate_dat(T,[validate_dat2(Id,E,Dat) | V]).

 7243: validate_dat1(L)  -> {error,L}.

 7247:           {E,E} -> ok;
 7248:           {E,A} -> {E,A}
 7249:         end,

 7363: 				     [Db, 'RowStatus', ?active]),
 7364:     {value, ?destroy} = rpc:call(MaNode, snmpa, enum_to_int,
 7365: 				       [Db, 'RowStatus', destroy]),
 7366:     false = rpc:call(MaNode, snmpa, enum_to_int,
 7367: 			   [Db, 'RowStatus', xxxdestroy]),
 7368:     false = rpc:call(MaNode, snmpa, enum_to_int,
 7369: 			   [Db, 'xxRowStatus', destroy]),
 7370:     false = rpc:call(MaNode, snmpa, int_to_enum, [Db, 'RowStatus', 25]),
 7371:     false = rpc:call(MaNode, snmpa, int_to_enum, [Db, 'xxRowStatus', 1]),

 7529: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 7530: %% Ticket: OTP-16092
 7531: %% Slogan: Extra socket options
 7532: %%         We perform simple start and stop tests with and without
 7533: %%         this option.
 7534: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 7535: 
 7536: otp16092_cases() ->
 7537:     [
 7538:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop1, % default
 7539:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop2, % []
 7540:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop3, % bad => ignored
 7541:      otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop4  % invalid content
 7542:     ].
 7543: 
 7544: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop1(Config) ->
 7545:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7546:                                     Config, default, success).
 7547: 
 7548: 
 7549: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop2(Config) ->
 7550:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7551:                                     Config, [], success).
 7552: 
 7553: 
 7554: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop3(Config) ->
 7555:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7556:                                     Config,
 7557:                                     'this-should-be-ignored',
 7558:                                     success).
 7559: 
 7560: 
 7561: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop4(Config) ->
 7562:     otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 7563:                                     Config,
 7564:                                     ['this-should-fail'],
 7565:                                     failure).
 7566: 
 7567: otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(CaseName, Config, ESO, Expected)
 7568:   when is_atom(CaseName) ->
 7569:     Pre  = fun() ->
 7570:                    [D|_] = lists:reverse(atom_to_list(CaseName)),
 7571:                    Digit = [D],
 7572:                            
 7573:                    ?NPRINT("try start agent node"),
 7574:                    {ok, Peer, Node} = ?START_PEER(Digit ++ "-agent"),
 7575: 
 7576:                    ?NPRINT("try write config to file"),
 7577:                    ConfDir   = ?config(agent_conf_dir, Config),
 7578:                    DbDir     = ?config(agent_db_dir,   Config),
 7579:                    Vsns      = [v1],
 7580:                    IP        = tuple_to_list(?config(ip, Config)),
 7581:                    ManagerIP = IP,
 7582:                    TrapPort  = ?TRAP_UDP,
 7583:                    AgentIP   = IP,
 7584:                    AgentPort = 4000,
 7585:                    SysName   = "test",
 7586:                    ok = snmp_config:write_agent_snmp_files(ConfDir, Vsns,
 7587:                                                            ManagerIP, TrapPort,
 7588:                                                            AgentIP, AgentPort,
 7589:                                                            SysName),
 7590: 
 7591:                    #{eso       => ESO,
 7592:                      vsns      => Vsns,
 7593:                      db_dir    => DbDir,
 7594:                      conf_opts => [{dir,        ConfDir},
 7595:                                    {force_load, false}, 
 7596:                                    {verbosity,  trace}],
 7597:                      node      => Node,
 7598:                      peer      => Peer,
 7599:                      expected  => Expected}
 7600:            end,
 7601:     Case = fun(State) ->
 7602:                    do_otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(State)
 7603:            end,
 7604:     Post = fun(#{node := Node,
 7605:                  peer := Peer}) ->
 7606:                    ?NPRINT("try stop agent node ~p", [Node]),
 7607:                    ?STOP_PEER(Peer)
 7608:            end,
 7609:     ?TC_TRY(CaseName, Pre, Case, Post).
 7610: 
 7611: do_otp_16092_simple_start_and_stop(#{eso       := ESO,
 7612:                                      vsns      := Vsns,
 7613:                                      db_dir    := DbDir,
 7614:                                      conf_opts := ConfOpts,
 7615:                                      node      := Node,
 7616:                                      expected  := Expected} = _State) ->
 7617:     NiOpts =
 7618:         case ESO of
 7619:             default ->
 7620:                 [{verbosity, trace}];
 7621:             _ -> 
 7622:                 [{verbosity, trace}, {options, [{extra_sock_opts, ESO}]}]
 7623:         end,
 7624: 
 7625:     Opts = [{agent_type, master},
 7626:             {versions,   Vsns},
 7627:             {db_dir,     DbDir},
 7628:             {config,     ConfOpts},
 7629:             {net_if,     NiOpts}],
 7630: 
 7631:     otp16092_try_start_and_stop_agent(Node, Opts, Expected),
 7632: 
 7633:     ?NPRINT("done"),
 7634:     ok.
 7635: 
 7636: otp16092_try_start_and_stop_agent(Node, Opts, Expected) ->
 7637:     ?IPRINT("try start snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p) - expect ~p", 
 7638:             [Node, Expected]),
 7639:     case start_standalone_agent(Node, Opts) of
 7640:         {ok, Pid} when is_pid(Pid) andalso (Expected =:= success) ->
 7641:             ?IPRINT("Expected success starting snmp (agent) supervisor"),
 7642:             ?SLEEP(1000),
 7643:             stop_standalone_agent(Pid),
 7644:             ok;
 7645:         {ok, Pid} when is_pid(Pid) andalso (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7646:             ?EPRINT("Unexpected success starting snmp (agent) supervisor: (~p)",
 7647:                     [Pid]),
 7648:             ?SLEEP(1000),
 7649:             stop_standalone_agent(Pid),
 7650:             ?FAIL('unexpected-start-success');
 7651: 
 7652:         {error,
 7653:          shutdown,
 7654:          {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent_sup,
 7655:           {shutdown,
 7656:            {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent,
 7657:             {net_if_error, Reason}}}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7658:             ?IPRINT("Expected (shutdown, net-if) error starting "
 7659:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7660:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7661:             ok;
 7662:         {error, {shutdown, Reason}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7663:             ?IPRINT("Expected (shutdown) error starting "
 7664:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7665:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7666:             ok;
 7667:         {error, Reason} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7668:             ?IPRINT("Expected error starting snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7669:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7670:             ok;
 7671: 
 7672:         {badrpc, 
 7673:          {'EXIT',
 7674:           {shutdown,
 7675:            {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent_sup,
 7676:             {shutdown,
 7677:              {failed_to_start_child, snmpa_agent,
 7678:               {net_if_error, Reason}}}}}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7679:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc, shutdown, net-if) error starting "
 7680:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7681:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7682:             ok;
 7683:         {badrpc, {'EXIT', {shutdown, Reason}}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7684:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc, shutdown) error starting "
 7685:                     "snmp (agent) supervisor (on ~p):"
 7686:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7687:             ok;
 7688:         {badrpc, {'EXIT', Reason}} when (Expected =:= failure) ->
 7689:             ?IPRINT("Expected (badrpc) error starting snmp (agent) supervisor "
 7690:                       "(on ~p):"
 7691:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7692:             ok;
 7693: 
 7694:         {badrpc, Reason} = BADRPC ->
 7695:             ?WPRINT("Bad RPC to node ~p failed:"
 7696:                     "~n   ~p", [Node, Reason]),
 7697:             ?SKIP({BADRPC, Node})
 7698: 
 7699:     end,
 7700:     ok.
 7701:

 7873: otp9884(doc) ->
 7874:     "OTP-9884 - Simultaneous backup(s) call should not work. ";
 7875: 
 7876: otp9884(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 7877:     ?DBG("otp9884 -> entry with"
 7878: 	 "~n   Config: ~p", [Config]),
 7879: 
 7880:     AgentNode = ?config(agent_node, Config),
 7881:     [AgentBkpDir1, AgentBkpDir2] = ?config(agent_backup_dirs, Config),
 7882:     Self = self(), 
 7883:     timer:apply_after(1000,
 7884: 		      ?MODULE,
 7885:                       otp9884_backup,
 7886:                       [AgentNode, Self, first,  AgentBkpDir1]),
 7887:     timer:apply_after(1000,
 7888: 		      ?MODULE,
 7889:                       otp9884_backup,
 7890:                       [AgentNode, Self, second, AgentBkpDir2]),
 7891:     otp9884_await_backup_started(),
 7892:     otp9884_await_backup_completion(undefined, undefined),
 7893: 
 7894:     ?DBG("otp9884 -> done", []),
 7895:     ok.
 7896: 
 7897: 
 7898: otp9884_backup(Node, Pid, Tag, Dir) ->
 7899:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup - await continue", [Tag]),
 7900:     Pid ! {otp9884_backup_started, Tag, self()},
 7901:     receive
 7902:         {otp9884_backup_continue, Tag, Pid} ->
 7903:             ok
 7904:     end,
 7905:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup start", [Tag]),
 7906:     Res = rpc:call(Node, snmpa, backup, [Dir]),
 7907:     ?IPRINT("[~w] backup result: ~p", [Tag, Res]),
 7908:     Pid ! {otp9884_backup_complete, Tag, Res}.
 7909: 
 7910: 
 7911: otp9884_await_backup_started() ->
 7912:     otp9884_await_backup_started(undefined, undefined).
 7913: 
 7914: otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Second)
 7915:   when is_pid(First) andalso is_pid(Second) ->
 7916:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> order first continue"),
 7917:     First  ! {otp9884_backup_continue, first, self()},
 7918:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> order second continue"),
 7919:     Second ! {otp9884_backup_continue, second, self()},
 7920:     ok;
 7921: otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Second) ->
 7922:     receive
 7923:         {otp9884_backup_started, first, Pid} when (First =:= undefined) ->
 7924:             ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> received started from first"),
 7925:             otp9884_await_backup_started(Pid, Second);
 7926:         {otp9884_backup_started, second, Pid} when (Second =:= undefined) ->
 7927:             ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_started -> received started from second"),
 7928:             otp9884_await_backup_started(First, Pid)
 7929:     end.
 7930:     
 7931: otp9884_await_backup_completion(ok, Second) 
 7932:   when ((Second =/= ok) andalso (Second =/= undefined)) ->
 7933:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 7934:             "first backup succeed and second failed (~p)", [Second]),
 7935:     ok;
 7936: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, ok) 
 7937:   when ((First =/= ok) andalso (First =/= undefined)) ->
 7938:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 7939:             "second backup succeed and first failed (~p)", [First]),
 7940:     ok;
 7941: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Second) 
 7942:   when (((First =:= undefined) andalso (Second =:= undefined)) 
 7943: 	orelse 
 7944: 	((First =:= undefined) andalso (Second =/= undefined)) 
 7945: 	orelse 
 7946: 	((First =/= undefined) andalso (Second =:= undefined))) ->
 7947:     ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> await complete messages"),
 7948:     receive
 7949: 	{otp9884_backup_complete, first, Res} ->
 7950: 	    ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 7951:                     "received complete message for first: ~p", [Res]),
 7952: 	    otp9884_await_backup_completion(Res, Second);
 7953: 	{otp9884_backup_complete, second, Res} ->
 7954: 	    ?IPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> "
 7955:                     "received complete message for second: ~p", [Res]),
 7956: 	    otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Res)
 7957:     after 10000 ->
 7958: 	    %% we have waited long enough
 7959:             ?EPRINT("otp9884_await_backup_completion -> timeout"),
 7960: 	    throw({error, {timeout, First, Second}})
 7961:     end;
 7962: otp9884_await_backup_completion(First, Second) ->
 7963:     ?EPRINT("Bad Completion: "
 7964:             "~n      First:  ~p"
 7965:             "~n      Second: ~p", [First, Second]),
 7966:     throw({error, {bad_completion, First, Second}}).
 7967: 
 7968:
